text: [Music]
I'm Heather Melton
I'm a senior exercise physiologist and
why you Lang good health
maximize the amount of energy you're
using when you are walking or running on
an incline or not is to maintain good
upper body form and that includes
keeping your core engaged throughout the
entire exercise as well as maintaining
good arm form so you're moving in a hand
to pocket position with your arms moving
forward and it back if you're swinging
your arms a lot of people tend to either
keep their arms up really tight or let
them go out to the side so we want to
make sure that your arms are moving in
the direction that you want to be going
whether or not you're on a treadmill or
outside and your hands swing down to
about your hip level and come back up so
your elbows stay at a 90 degree and
you're just swinging forward and back
they hand to a pocket position can
improve your stability of the upper body
as well as help you to continue to
maximize the amount of whole body
exercise you're doing when you are
running rather than holding on if you're
on a treadmill when you see runners that
have more of what we call cross body
position of their arms that generally is
an indication of decreased activation or
maybe even weakness at the core
musculature
[Music]
